channel.title: [667/724] Client Issues [NRS3]
channel.description: Alright, So recently i've been working on a server, And when i try to run my client, It's stuck at 1% loading. I've port forwarded (checked twice: http://prntscr.com/elkn2 ) (My firewall is not blocking the port either.) I've tried to host it with: No-IP Ip, My Actual IP, Local Ip(127.0.0.1) Which one do i use it as? Thank you --Nex EDIT: The source i'm using is a semi-cleaned version of NRS3

item.title: [667/724] Client Issues [NRS3]
item.dc:creator: @NexRSPS NexRSPS
item.description:
@NexRSPS wrote:

In my loader.java
on line 124 it says this

do i still have to change it, what do i have to change to my ip or is it just connecting from line 31’s ip?
Also,
after i did that i now get this error from gamestub.java line 475

[code]
src\GameStub.java:475: error: unreachable statement
if (b != -45) {
^
src\Class381.java:20: warning: non-varargs call of varargs method with inexact a
rgument type for last parameter;
Method method = var_class.getDeclaredMethod(“get
PlatformMBeanServer”, null);

                  ^

cast to Class for a varargs call
cast to Class[] for a non-varargs call and to suppress this warning
src\Class381.java:21: warning: non-varargs call of varargs method with inexact a
rgument type for last parameter;
Object object = method.invoke(null, null);
^
cast to Object for a varargs call
cast to Object[] for a non-varargs call and to suppress this warning
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
2 warnings[/code]
I have never gotten that error on my client compiler before. And i’m wondering, what i should do.
Here is what line 475 looks like in gamestub.java

Line 473: final boolean method95(byte b) { Line 474: return true;
Line 475: if (b != -45) {

Line 476: return true; Line 477: }
Or raw data:

final boolean method95(byte b) { return true; if (b != -45) { return true; }
Any help? lol. Thanks.
EDIT:
Bump.

Read full topic

item.title: [667/724] Client Issues [NRS3]
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

[ul]you only need to set youre ip in the client really. Make sure you have ALL the possible ip’s in there changed to yours. Check these files…

[list]
[li]Client.java[/li][/list]

Lines 7959ish and 7961ish*

[list][li]GameStub.java[/li][/list]

Line 492ish*

[list][li]Loader.java[/li][/list]

Lines 31ish and 124ish*
*Give or take a few lines… Depending on the client you have.[/ul]

Read full topic

item.title: [667/724] Client Issues [NRS3]
item.dc:creator: @NexRSPS NexRSPS
item.description:
@NexRSPS wrote:

Ok, So which IP do i change in the client? I’ve tried all my ones and i don’t know if i need to put my normal ip in one, no-ip in another or something like that.
Thanks,

Read full topic

item.title: [667/724] Client Issues [NRS3]
item.dc:creator: @vyre-scape vyre-scape
item.description:
@vyre-scape wrote:

You don’t have to change the IP on the source, only port - which is in Settings.java

Read full topic

item.description:

Alright, So recently i’ve been working on a server, And when i try to run my
client, It’s stuck at 1% loading.
I’ve port forwarded (checked twice: http://prntscr.com/elkn2 ) (My firewall is not blocking the port either.)

My Actual IP,

Which one do i use it as?
